item.title: 欧盟批准新日铁以 149 亿美元收购美国钢铁公司
item.description: 欧盟委员会周一批准了美国钢铁公司以 149 亿美元收购日本新日铁公司的交易。【原文：The European Commission on Monday approved U.S. Steel's $14.9 billion buyout by Japan's Nippon Steel .】

item.title: 诺维信第一大股东 Shah Capital 加大力度重组董事会
item.description: 对冲基金 Shah Capital 周一敦促 Novavax 股东投票反对三名董事的连任以及与高管薪酬相关的提案，加大了对这家 COVID-19 疫苗生产商董事会改组的力度。【原文：Hedge fund Shah Capital on Monday urged Novavax shareholders to vote against the re-election of three directors and proposals related to executive compensation, ramping up its efforts for a board shakeup at the COVID-19 vaccine maker.】

item.title: 加拿大布鲁克菲尔德公司将向私人信贷管理公司 Castlelake 投资 15 亿美元
item.description: 加拿大布鲁克菲尔德资产管理公司（Brookfield Asset Management）周一表示，将向美国私人信贷管理公司 Castlelake 投资约 15 亿美元。【原文：Canada's Brookfield Asset Management will invest about $1.5 billion in U.S.-based private credit manager Castlelake, the companies said on Monday.】

item.title: 泰森食品公司因成本控制努力实现超预期利润，但销售额下滑
item.description: 泰森食品公司（Tyson Foods）周一公布的第二季度利润超出华尔街预期，因为该公司开始从关闭一些鸡肉加工厂以降低成本中获益。【原文：Tyson Foods surpassed Wall Street expectations for second-quarter profit on Monday, as it begins to reap the benefits of shutting some chicken processing plants to reduce costs.】

item.title: 由于国内需求增长缓慢，精神航空预计第二季度收入疲软
item.description: 精神航空公司（Spirit Airlines）周一预计，由于国内需求改善缓慢以及数十架飞机停飞，该公司第二季度收入将出现疲软。【原文：Spirit Airlines forecast weak second-quarter revenue on Monday due to sluggish improvement in domestic demand and grounding of dozens of its aircraft.】

item.title: 美国公用事业公司 Allete 完成 62 亿美元私有化交易
item.description: Allete 周一表示，由加拿大养老金计划投资委员会和全球基础设施合作伙伴牵头的合伙企业将以 62 亿美元（包括债务）的价格收购这家美国公用事业公司。【原文：Allete said on Monday a partnership led by Canada Pension Plan Investment Board and Global Infrastructure Partners would acquire the U.S. utility for $6.2 billion, including debt.】

item.title: 独家报道：哥伦比亚 Ecopetrol 探索参与海上风电拍卖
item.description: 哥伦比亚国有能源公司 Ecopetrol 在给路透社的一份声明中说，该公司正在分析直接参与安第斯国家首次海上风电拍卖的可能性。【原文：Colombia's majority state-owned energy company Ecopetrol is analyzing its potential direct participation in the Andean country's first-ever offshore wind auction, the company said in a statement to Reuters.】

item.title: 由于投资收益回报丰厚，Loews 公布利润增加
item.description: Loews Corp 周一公布的第一季度利润与上年同期相比增长了近 22%，这主要得益于较高的保费和强劲的投资回报。【原文：Loews Corp on Monday reported a near 22% jump in first-quarter profit compared with the previous year, helped by higher premiums and strong returns on its investments.】

item.title: 受降息押注影响，期货走高
item.description: 美国股指期货周一走高，表明华尔街将出现更多涨幅，因为交易商认为美联储今年降息的可能性更大。【原文：U.S. stock index futures edged higher on Monday, pointing to more gains on Wall Street, as traders priced in a higher chance of the Federal Reserve cutting interest rates this year.】

item.title: 聚焦：丹尼餐厅因 "妊娠猪笼 "承诺面临代理投票
item.description: 丹尼公司（Denny's Corp）即将举行的股东投票可能会向该公司施压，要求其设定目标，减少使用供应商提供的猪肉。【原文：An upcoming shareholder vote at Denny’s Corp could pressure the company to set targets for reducing its use of pork from suppliers that keep pregnant pigs in tight confinement, called gestation crates.】

item.title: 马萨诸塞州最高法院将审理对 "打工者 "投票措施的质疑
item.description: 马萨诸塞州最高法院周一将审议该州选民是否能决定 11 月的两项投票提案，这两项提案将重新定义 Uber Technologies 和 Lyft 等基于应用程序的公司与其司机之间的关系，其中一项提案得到了行业支持，另一项提案则得到了劳工支持。【原文：The top Massachusetts court on Monday is set to consider whether the state's voters will get to decide two ballot proposals in November that would redefine the relationship between app-based companies like Uber Technologies and Lyft and their drivers - one backed by industry and the other by labor.】

item.title: 沃伦-巴菲特的继任者格雷格-阿贝尔被视为伯克希尔文化的传承者
item.description: 格雷格-阿贝尔（Greg Abel）接替沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）执掌伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway）后，尽管他无法与传奇老板的明星效应相提并论，但他仍被寄予厚望，希望能传承这家巨型企业的文化。【原文：When Greg Abel succeeds Warren Buffett at the helm of Berkshire Hathaway , he is expected to preserve the culture at the behemoth even if he does not match the star power of his legendary boss.】

item.title: 沃伦-巴菲特的粉丝们为他离开后制定了自己的路线
item.description: 现年 93 岁的伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway）亿万富豪掌门人沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）上周六对股东们说，如果幸运的话，他还能再活六七年，但他补充说，"明天就可能结束"。【原文：Warren Buffett, the 93-year-old billionaire chief of Berkshire Hathaway, mulled his future in telling shareholders on Saturday that if he were lucky, he would have another six or seven years but added that "it could end tomorrow."】

item.title: 早间竞标：到处都有救济（大部分
item.description: Dhara Ranasinghe 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天。【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Dhara Ranasinghe.】

item.title: 哈里斯副总统宣布投入 1 亿多美元支持汽车工人
item.description: 美国副总统卡马拉-哈里斯（Kamala Harris）周一宣布提供超过 1 亿美元的资金和资源，以支持美国汽车工人和小型汽车供应商。【原文：U.S. Vice President Kamala Harris on Monday announced more than $100 million in funding and resources to support American auto workers and small auto suppliers.】

item.title: 法国汽车制造商的目标是到 2027 年电动汽车销量猛增四倍
item.description: 就在中国国家主席开始对法国进行国事访问之际，法国汽车工业将根据周一与政府签署的战略协议，力争到 2027 年将电动汽车销量提高四倍。【原文：France's car industry will aim to ramp up electric car sales fourfold by 2027 under a strategy agreement to be signed with the government on Monday, just as the president of China embarks on a state visit in the country.】

item.title: 五一假期与 2023 年相比，中国房屋销售下滑 47
item.description: 据周一的一项民间调查显示，中国五一重大节假日期间的日均房屋销售量比去年同期下降了47%，比2019年节假日前的同期水平下降了约30%。【原文：China's average daily home sales during the major May Day public holiday sank 47% from a year earlier, and were down around 30% from pre-pandemic levels in 2019 for the same holiday period, according to a private survey on Monday.】

item.title: 报纸称萨瓦德尔董事会开会分析 BBVA 的竞购方案
item.description: 据《先锋报》（La Vanguardia）等多家报纸报道，西班牙萨瓦德尔银行（Sabadell）董事会将于周一召开会议，讨论更大的竞争对手 BBVA 提出的全股收购要约，该要约上周宣布时价值约 120 亿欧元（129 亿美元）。【原文：Spanish bank Sabadell's board will meet on Monday to discuss an all-share offer from bigger rival BBVA that was worth around 12 billion euros ($12.9 billion) when it was announced last week, newspapers including La Vanguardia said.】

item.title: 消息人士称，KKR 将以 8.39 亿美元的估值收购印度 Healthium Medtech 公司
item.description: 全球投资公司 KKR 将从英国 Apax Partners 手中收购印度医疗设备制造商 Healthium Medtech，三位直接知情人士透露，这笔交易的估值为 700 亿卢比（8.386 亿美元）。【原文：Global investment firm KKR will buy Indian medical devices maker Healthium Medtech from UK-based Apax Partners in a deal that three sources with direct knowledge of the matter say is valued at 70 billion rupees ($838.60 million).】

item.title: 沃尔沃汽车四月份销量同比增长 27
item.description: 总部位于瑞典的沃尔沃汽车集团周一在一份声明中说，4 月份的销量同比增长 27%，达到 65,838 辆。【原文：Volvo Cars' sales rose 27% in April from a year earlier to 65,838 cars, the Sweden-based group said in a statement on Monday.】

item.title: 马士基称，红海中断使第二季度运力减少 15%-20%。
item.description: 航运集团马士基周一表示，红海集装箱运输中断的情况正在恶化，预计第二季度该行业在远东和欧洲之间的运力将减少约 15%-20%。【原文：The disruption to container shipping traffic in the Red Sea is worsening, and is expected to reduce the industry's capacity between the Far East and Europe by some 15%-20% in the second quarter, shipping group Maersk said on Monday.】

item.title: 阿托斯称收到四份重组提议
item.description: 濒临破产的法国 IT 公司 Atos 周一证实，该公司已收到来自投资者的四份不同的债务重组和现金注入要约。【原文：Ailing French IT company Atos on Monday confirmed it had received four distinct offers from investors to restructure its debt and inject cash into the business.】

item.title: 中国关税可能导致干邑生产商白兰地过剩
item.description: 根据路透社的计算，中国对欧盟白兰地征收高额关税将使法国公司大量白兰地难以在其他地方销售，分析师和投资者担心公司可能被迫打折。【原文：High Chinese tariffs on EU brandy would leave French companies with vast amounts of cognac that could be hard to sell elsewhere, according to Reuters' calculations, analysts, and investors who fear firms could be forced to discount.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，瑞士信贷最后一任首席执行官乌尔里希-科纳将离开瑞银集团
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周一报道，瑞士信贷集团（Credit Suisse）最后一任首席执行官乌尔里希-科纳（Ulrich Korner）将在未来几周内离开瑞银集团。【原文：Ulrich Korner, the final CEO of Credit Suisse, is set to leave UBS in the coming weeks, the Financial Times reported on Monday.】

item.title: 加拿大西捷航空公司与工会达成避免停工的临时协议
item.description: 加拿大西捷航空集团（WestJet Group）周一在一份联合声明中说，该集团已与代表其维修工程师的工会达成了避免停工的临时协议。【原文：Canadian airline WestJet Group has reached a tentative agreement with the union representing its maintenance engineers to avert work stoppage, the two parties said in a joint statement on Monday.】

item.title: 早间竞标：重回降息轨道
item.description: Rae Wee 对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Rae Wee】

item.title: 印尼第一季度国内生产总值（GDP）增长超出预期，创 3 个季度以来最高水平
item.description: 印尼统计局周一公布的数据显示，印尼第一季度经济同比增长5.11%，创下三个季度以来的最高增速，且快于预期。【原文：Indonesia's economy grew by 5.11% in the first quarter from a year earlier, the highest in three quarters and faster than expected, data from the statistics bureau showed on Monday.】

item.title: 首席经济学家莱恩：欧洲央行降息理由越来越充分
item.description: 欧洲央行首席经济学家菲利普-莱恩（Philip Lane）周一告诉西班牙报纸《El Confidencial》，随着服务业通胀终于开始缓解，欧洲央行 6 月份降息的理由越来越充分。【原文：The case for a European Central Bank interest rate cut in June is getting stronger as services inflation is finally starting to ease, ECB Chief Economist Philip Lane told Spanish newspaper El Confidencial on Monday.】

item.title: 中国和美国电动汽车的增长将导致今年汽油需求增长放缓
item.description: 分析师称，受中国和美国转向电动汽车以及去年 COVID-19 之后消费恢复正常的影响，2024 年全球汽油需求增长可能减半，从而挤压炼油厂下半年的利润。【原文：Global petrol demand growth could halve in 2024, squeezing second-half refinery margins, analysts said, driven by a shift to electric cars in China and the United States and a return to normal consumption after last year's bounce following COVID-19.】

item.title: 亚洲股市因美联储减息押注而反弹；日元缩减涨幅
item.description: 亚洲股市周一上涨，原因是市场再次押注美联储可能在今年放宽利率，而日元在上周因东京疑似货币干预而大幅飙升后走软。【原文：Asian stocks rose on Monday on renewed bets that the Federal Reserve would likely ease rates this year, while the yen weakened after a strong surge last week from Tokyo's suspected currency intervention.】
